greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal base b such that (b^Prime(n)+1)/(b+1) is prime.
comment: Conjecture: sequence is defined for any n>=2.
mathematica: Do[p=Prime[k]; n=2; cp=(n^p+1)/(n+1); While[ !PrimeQ[cp], n=n+1; cp=(n^p+1)/(n+1)]; Print[n], {k, 2, 200}]
results.author: _Lei Zhou_, Feb 23 2005
